newsitem.title: CHINA: China to launch economic information network.
newsitem.headline: China to launch economic information network.

text.p: Chinese economic authorities will next month formally launch a national computer service to supply economic information over the Internet, officials said on Wednesday.

The State Information Centre's China Economic Information Network (CEInet) would provide users with information on the macro-economy, investment opportunities and other services, an official of the centre said.
"At the moment, our network is non-profitmaking," she told Reuters by telephone. "It's a measure in our country's construction of the information highway."
Most services to be officially offered from December 3 would be in Chinese, but the information centre intended to eventually provide all services in English as well, the official said.

CEInet was wholly owned by the state and would provide economic information from the State Information Centre, a major economic information supplier to Chinese government ministries, another centre official said.
